data.title: TextField (or text-input in general) broken when setContinuousRendering(false)
data.body:
How to replicate the issue:
1. Create a TextField
2. Set Gdx.graphics.setContinuousRendering(false)
3. Type in the textfield

The input begins repeating as soon as the key is pressed, makes typing impossible.

This issue seems to be desktop only, as it doesn't appear on Android devices. As a result, I currently have setContinuousRendering(false) only when the ApplicationType is not Desktop.

data.title: PolygonSpriteBatch / SpriteBatch shader handling
data.body:
I see several "if (customShader != null)" peppered through the code for the sprite batches.  Since there's only one location that the shader can change, why not just have those checks localized to "setShader" and simply have a "currentShader" that is referenced throughout the code?  This would eliminate all the extra checks in begin, end, flush, setupMatrices, etc

My only guess is that maybe since the default shader is final, that provides some sort of optimization given that most people won't be running a custom shader.

Thanks,
--tim

data.title: AnimatedTile support in TmxMapLoader
data.body:
AnimatedTiledMapTile doesn't support variable animation intervals, while the TMX format does. As a result, I set the interval in the frame loading loop, but only the last value gets used.  Good enough for me.  We can extend the AnimatedTiledMapTile in the future if we choose, and update the loader accordingly.

The TMX format is backwards-compatible with clients that don't support animations.  To do this, animated tiles replace the ids of static tiles (which may be used in the animation) so that Old clients will "see" a static tile. For example:

Tile 1 - Static tile
Tile 2 - Static tile
Tile 3 - Animated tile of Static Tiles 2, 3, and 4.
Tile 4 - Static tile

Static Tile 3 above is replaced with Animated Tile 3 if the client supports it.  Static Tile 3 exists, but only during loading really.  So we need to create all the Animated Tiles and store them in a separate array until they are all created so the Static Tile references can be resolved.  We then overwrite the Static Tiles in the tileset at the end.

Thanks Tomski!

data.title: Google code site's wiki should be deleted
data.body: I think all the wiki articles on the google code site should have the content deleted, and only leave the "Wiki has been replaced" text with a link to the github wiki.  It's easy for people to google a problem, click on the google code wiki link, and get some outdated information, despite the large "Wiki has been replaced text"

data.title: ResolutionFileResolver incorrect / prefix
Managed FTFGenerator and generated bitmap font
Adds ImmutableArray and ImmutableIntMap classes
data.body:
Methods can return `Array` and `IntMap` objects as references to `ImmutableArray` and `ImmutableIntMap` respectively to disallow operations that modify the state of such collections.

`ImmutableIntMap` allows iteration over values, keys and entries although calling `remove()` will throw `GdxRuntimeException`.

This would help in making APIs more robust and harder for the user to break things.

Ashley will depend on Libgdx core to avoid containers duplication and it would need this immutable interfaces.

Later on, if people like this, we could add them to the rest of collections.

@badlogic asked me to create a PR rather than commiting directly so we can discuss the details more easily.

data.title: Fling does not work as expected
data.body: After testing the recent version (https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/1988) and the former version of GestureDetector class, I see there's a problem with fling in both versions. The Fling event is always triggered after a drag and does not take into account the parameter maxFlingDelay as expected.

data.body:
After using the snapshot array, specifically the SnapshotArray<Object>(ordered, capacity, arrayType) constructor. This is the Development Mode information at the time of the crash:
12:49:24.169 [DEBUG] [html] Rebinding com.badlogic.gwtref.client.IReflectionCache
and 
    [DEBUG] [html] - Invoking generator com.badlogic.gwtref.gen.ReflectionCacheGenerator ,
        [INFO] [html] - com.badlogic.gwtref.client.IReflectionCache ,
        [INFO] [html] - Skipping non-visible constructor for class Colors ,
        [INFO] [html] - Interpolation can't be instantiated. Constructors not generated ,
        [INFO] [html] - Action can't be instantiated. Constructors not generated.
and the compile console says:
com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.utils.DragAndDrop
    com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.utils.DragAndDrop.Payload

data.title: Add a test to show what happens when a long http request is canceled
data.body:
See https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/1287#issuecomment-47743225 for a description of the problem.

To see the problem, click the "GET Large" button, and then try canceling or clicking on another button to start another request before the first finishes.

The application will be blocked until the first download completes.

data.title: Controller Vibration
data.body: I'd like to add gamepad vibration to my game. It appears to not currently exist in the controller extension. If OIS supports it, what are the chances of this being added sometime soon?

data.title: scene2d Window pack() bug.
data.body: I have a simple scene2d window, heres the code: http://pastebin.com/FfvpbFLf . Now the problem is, when window is packed, the fonts in all the window get distorted like this http://tinypic.com/view.php?pic=295wq4n&s=8#.U7GZlvjkCxB when character count in one of the buttons exceeds ~13. If i comment out pack(), and set window's width by hand, everything works fine. I use this skin of mine in several other windows and dialogs, some of them having text buttons, but everything works fine. Ive also tried to swap this custom skin pack file of mine to the libgdx's uiskin.png and other files which come with it, and the problem disappears in that same window in the picture above.
